str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
To forget, neglect. Middle voice from epi and lanthano; to lose out of mind; by implication, to neglect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To show forth, prove. From en and deiknuo; to indicate.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
